docs.snippet: The builder of the Kawaida Towers housing project, barred by demonstrators yesterday from moving a bulldozer and laborers onto the construction site, announced today that he would make no further effort to continue work while the dispute was befor...
docs.lead_paragraph: The builder of the Kawaida Towers housing project, barred by demonstrators yesterday from moving a bulldozer and laborers onto the construction site, announced today that he would make no further effort to continue work while the dispute was before a court.
docs.abstract: B J Builders of NJ Inc, prime contractor for Kawaida Towers housing project in Newark, NJ, announces Feb 13 that co will make no more effort to continue work while dispute is before ct; statement was made following hearing before NJ Superior Ct Judge Kimmelman, who viewed 25-min videotape of demonstration on Feb 12, T Geiser, atty for B J Builders, says delays are costing 'thousands of dollars a day'; protest against Kawaida Towers project is led by Assemblyman Imperiale, who lives in North Ward sec where project is planned

headline.main: KAWAIDA BUILDER WAITS FOR RULING; Plans No Effort to Resume Work While the Dispute Is Pending in Court Hearing Scheduled State Mortgage Provided

byline.original: By WALTER H. WAGGONERSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A group of 200 shouting demonstrators succeeded today in preventing a bulldozer and a crew of laborers from going to work at the site of the Kawaida Towers housing project....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of 200 shouting demonstrators succeeded today in preventing a bulldozer and a crew of laborers from going to work at the site of the Kawaida Towers housing project.
docs.abstract: group of 200 shouting demonstrators succeeds Feb 12 in preventing bulldozer and workmen from entering site at Kawaida Towers housing project, Newark, NJ; ct orders signed by NJ Superior Ct Judge Kimmelman several wks ago stipulated that pickets must keep 6 ft of space between them and clear path for any equipment coming onto site but today demonstrators marched in close formation, as police looked on, and surged around truck despite attempts to keep them back; F DeTrolio, excavating contractor, criticized police but Police Dir Kerr said that at time DeTrolio decided to leave police had cleared path; DeTrolio says bulldozer could have lurched and killed someone because demonstrators were so close; role of Police Dept has been criticized since Patrolman Gasparinetti, pres of Newark Patrolmen's Benevolent Assn, openly supported demonstration; J Geiser, atty for B J Builders of NJ Inc, prime contractor, says he intends to ask Judge Kimmelman again to move pickets to side streets; illus of demonstrators and of Assemblyman Imperiale

headline.main: Demonstrators Bar Bulldozer And Laborers at Kawaida Site; 200 Demonstrators Bar Bulldozer at Kawaida Site

byline.original: By JOSEPH F. SULLIVANSpecial to The New York Times
